definition: to regard as
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Or, you can see them as the body's natural defense system.
sentences.chinese: 不過你也可以把它們看成是身體的自然免疫系統。

sentences.english: Status Offline Why See the Glass Half Empty?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼要把杯子看成是半杯空的呢？

sentences.english: I mistook the stick for a snake.
sentences.chinese: 我把那根棒子錯看成蛇了。

sentences.english: Thus it is more suitable to regard Gan as a sub-category under the Hakka-Gan dialect.
sentences.chinese: 把贛方言看成是客贛語的一個次方言更有其合理性。

sentences.english: We are much too apt to look at schism in our church as an unmitigated evil.
sentences.chinese: 我們太容易把自己教會中的分立看成是十惡不赦的。

sentences.english: Youth, in particular, are seen as beacons of innovation and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人特別被看成是革新和創造的希望。

sentences.english: The lattice is a bunch of masses and springs.
sentences.chinese: 晶格可以看成是一堆有質量的彈簧。

sentences.english: I still see it as dance music in a way.
sentences.chinese: 在某一方面我還是把它看成是舞曲。

sentences.english: She considers each one of you as one of Her many children also.
sentences.chinese: 她同樣也把你們每個人都看成是她衆多孩子中的一個。

sentences.english: Envision the conductor as an assemblage of driven, damped oscillators .
sentences.chinese: 把導體看成是大量受迫阻尼振動的振子的集合。
請把貧民窟的人看成拓荒者。

sentences.english: And sometimes we model light as a wave.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我們把光看成一種波。

sentences.english: Telling them they are late could be seen as undermining their position over you.
sentences.chinese: 告訴老闆他們遲到了可能被看成你在藐視他們的地位。

sentences.english: Don't look at it as people crucifying your coding style.
sentences.chinese: 不要把別人的檢查，看成是對代碼風格的苛求。

sentences.english: It is far more painful to regard knowledge as the absolute truth than to be ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 把知識看成絕對真理，會比無知痛苦更多。

sentences.english: The letter was dated May 16th but I misread it as 14th.
sentences.chinese: 信上的日期是5月16日，可我錯看成14日了。

to look upon/to regard
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
